intro: Bupleurum souliaei, commonly known as the Tibetan angelica, is a perennial herb native to the high altitudes of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its roots are often harvested for medicinal use in traditional Chinese medicine. Bupleurum souliaei thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to the harsh conditions of its mountainous habitat.
